page.title: 12A Walk in Knowle
page.content: A walk from Kixley Lane to Hampton Road, Knowle. July 1st 1985. Over the stile we followed the footpath and explored the fields. The sun was shining. It was long and full of flowers. We saw purple and white Clover, Ox-eye Daisies and Buttercups which we held under our chins to see if we liked butter. We saw Holly Blue Butterflies fluttering and Bumble Bees buzzing around the flowers and shiny red Ladybirds with seven black spots on thier backs. Swallows were swooping low in the sky looking for insects to eat. It was very quiet but we heard the other children in the distance playing in the school playground and a pigeon cooing in the trees. We looked at the hedge and counted 4 kinds of trees, Ash, Oak, Hazel and Hawthorn and we calculated that the hedge has been growing for 400 years.
